solution_line_template: He loses {pounds_lost_per_week_phase1} pounds a week for {weeks_phase1} weeks for a total of {pounds_lost_per_week_phase1}*{weeks_phase1}= <<{pounds_lost_per_week_phase1}*{weeks_phase1}={total_lost_phase1}>>{total_lost_phase1} pounds

He loses {pounds_lost_per_week_phase2} pounds a week for {weeks_phase2} weeks for a total of {pounds_lost_per_week_phase2}*{weeks_phase2} = <<{pounds_lost_per_week_phase2}*{weeks_phase2}={total_lost_phase2}>>{total_lost_phase2} pounds
All total he has lost {total_lost_phase1}+{total_lost_phase2} = <<{total_lost_phase1}+{total_lost_phase2}={total_pounds_lost}>>{total_pounds_lost} pounds

Jordan weighed {initial_weight} pounds and has lost {total_pounds_lost} pounds so he now weighs {initial_weight}-{total_pounds_lost} = <<{initial_weight}-{total_pounds_lost}={current_weight}>>{current_weight} pounds
